_header: Right as all strings are ruled in an harp
Title(s): ‘De regimene principum bonum consilium’; Liber Pluscardiensis
Subjects: counsel; princes, advice to; advice, to princes; political poems; chronicles, verse in
_description: ‘De regimene principum bonum consilium’ inserted in the Liber Pluscardiensis — 44 rhyme royal stanzas

BodFair8.First Lines:
Ryght as all strynges ar rewlyt in a harpeIn an acord & tunyt
                    all be an vth…
BodFair8.Last Lines:
…But gudly causes þou offendes to þe croun&
                    forfettes bayt to god & þin office

BodJones8.First Lines:
Ryt as all stryngs ar rewlyt in a harpIn an acord & tunyt all
                    be an uth…
BodJones8.Last Lines:
…But gudly cause you offends to the CrouneAnd forfetts bayt to
                    god & þin office

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Richt as all stringis ar cupillit in ane harpeIn ane accord and
                    tunit with I ane vthe…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…It þat I say twichand thy maiestieIs for the proffitt of
                    thy realme and the

Banna.First Lines:
Iustice wald haif ane godly presedentand auditor of the complaints
                    of the pure…
Banna.Last Lines:
…and put abak quhill grit caus be decyditSyne levand all for
                    pouerty may nocht bydit
Banna.Note:
Single stanza extract corresponding to lines 127-133 of edited version
                    in STS, 2nd ser., 7 or lines 127-133 of the edited version in STS,
                    2nd ser., 20.
